title: "Broken MIR" error on latest nightly
body:
When compiling [lsm-rs](https://github.com/kaimast/lsm-rs/) on latest rust I get a panic. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.60.0-nightly (17d29dcdc 2022-01-21) binary: rustc commit-hash: 17d29dcdce9b9e838635eb0adefd9b8b1588410b commit-date: 2022-01-21 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.60.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Notes This also happens on github actions, so I can reproduce it on multiple machines. I can only reproduce this on the most recent nightly (2022-01-21), 2022-01-20 and earlier work fine. The crate uses a few unstable features, that might trigger this. ### Backtrace
Backtrace

``` Compiling lsm v0.2.0 (/home/kai/dev/lsm-rs) error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_mir_transform/src/generator.rs:755:13: Broken MIR: generator contains type &mut dyn InternalIterator in MIR, but typeck only knows about {ResumeTy, &mut DbIteratorInner, usize, std::option::Option<(u64, usize)>, &mut [Box], Box, dyn InternalIterator, DbIteratorInner, std::option::Option>, &std::option::Option>, &Vec, bool, Pin + std::marker::Send>>, ()} and [&mut async_iter::DbIteratorInner, usize, std::option::Option<(u64, usize)>] --> src/async_iter.rs:121:83 | 121 | async fn parse_iter(&mut self, offset: usize, min_kv: MinKV) -> (bool, MinKV) { | ___________________________________________________________________________________^ 122 | | // Split slices to make the borrow checker happy 123 | | let (prev, cur) = self.iterators[..].split_at_mut(offset); 124 | | let iter = &mut *cur[0]; ... | 158 | | } 159 | | } | |_____^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/17d29dcdce9b9e838635eb0adefd9b8b1588410b/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1115:9 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic:: 1: std::panic::panic_any:: 2: ::span_bug:: 3: ::span_bug:: 4: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt::::{closure#0}, ()> 5: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt:: 6: rustc_middle::util::bug::span_bug_fmt:: 7: ::run_pass 8: rustc_mir_transform::pass_manager::run_passes 9: rustc_mir_transform::optimized_mir 10: >::with_task:: 11: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(&rustc_middle::mir::Body, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job::{closure#3}> 12: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 13: ::optimized_mir 14: ::generator_layout 15: >::layout_of_uncached 16: rustc_middle::ty::layout::layout_of 17: >::with_task::, core::result::Result, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError>> 18: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 19: ::layout_of 20: core::iter::adapters::process_results::, >::layout_of_uncached::{closure#5}::{closure#0}>, rustc_target::abi::TyAndLayout<&rustc_middle::ty::TyS>, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError, >, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError> as core::iter::traits::collect::FromIterator, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError>>>::from_iter, >::layout_of_uncached::{closure#5}::{closure#0}>>::{closure#0}, alloc::vec::Vec>> 21: core::iter::adapters::process_results::, >::layout_of_uncached::{closure#5}>, alloc::vec::Vec>, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError, >>, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError> as core::iter::traits::collect::FromIterator>, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError>>>::from_iter, >::layout_of_uncached::{closure#5}>>::{closure#0}, rustc_index::vec::IndexVec>>> 22: >::layout_of_uncached 23: rustc_middle::ty::layout::layout_of 24: >::with_task::, core::result::Result, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError>> 25: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 26: ::layout_of 27: rustc_middle::ty::layout::layout_of 28: >::with_task::, core::result::Result, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError>> 29: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 30: ::layout_of 31: ::run_pass 32: rustc_mir_transform::pass_manager::run_passes 33: rustc_mir_transform::optimized_mir 34: >::with_task:: 35: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(&rustc_middle::mir::Body, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job::{closure#3}> 36: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 37: ::optimized_mir 38: ::encode_crate_root 39: rustc_metadata::rmeta::encoder::encode_metadata_impl 40: rustc_data_structures::sync::join:: 41: rustc_metadata::rmeta::encoder::encode_metadata 42: ::enter::<::ongoing_codegen::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result, rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> 43: ::ongoing_codegen 44: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> 45: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 46: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.60.0-nightly (17d29dcdc 2022-01-21) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [optimized_mir] optimizing MIR for `async_iter::::parse_iter::{closure#0}` #1 [layout_of] computing layout of `[static generator@src/async_iter.rs:121:83: 159:6]` #2 [layout_of] computing layout of `core::future::from_generator::GenFuture<[static generator@src/async_iter.rs:121:83: 159:6]>` #3 [layout_of] computing layout of `impl core::future::future::Future` #4 [optimized_mir] optimizing MIR for `async_iter::::parse_iter` end of query stack error: could not compile `lsm` ```
